messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1706
messages.msgSnippet: ... Because I work for an animal shelter and foster dogs/cats here and have goats, 2 pot belly pigs, rabbits and lots of other creatures that need me in the
messages.messageBody:
>
> >
> >
>
> Why are you making him wait till 10? Just curious.
>
> NICKI~

Because I work for an animal shelter and foster dogs/cats here and have
goats, 2 pot belly pigs, rabbits and lots of other creatures that need me
in the morning. I cannot rush the job or something happens...he did get to
open them at 9:00 though :o) I got done sooner than I thought I would!

Jessi

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1706
messages.msgSnippet: Nicki, We have the same mother. No amount of reading or talking will change her mind. We need new mothers:-) Sarah ~xx~ ~xx~ ~xx~ Sarah Carothers
messages.messageBody:
Nicki,
We have the 'same' mother. No amount of reading or talking will
change her mind.
We need new mothers:-)
Sarah

Sarah Carothers

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1706
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/26/01 2:43:19 AM Mountain Standard Time, ... I ve thought about sending her books but I m not sure how it would come out. She in my guess
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/26/01 2:43:19 AM Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> ok.. so here's the plan. Next time she gets on our case, wants to
> "discuss" it, whip out a John Holt book (or my favorite Real Lives by
> Grace Lewellyn) and tell her the discussion will begin in one
> week..AFTER she's finished reading the book :-) :-P *Maybe* then,
> she'll either read it and learn or she'll stop the harassment. It
> will at least put you in a position to have something *to* discuss
> other than misled opinions about what you're doing ~or~ she won't
> bring it up because she'll never take the time to learn about it.
> Wishing you better success that I've had!
>

I've thought about sending her books but I'm not sure how it would come
out. She in my guess would read them and come out against them and my ideas
even stronger. She thinks Montessori and Waldorf theories on children reading
later (around 8 ) is pure bullshit. <her words. Now these and other theories
supporting it are very old but to her have no ground. There are windows and
if I miss them I have screwed up my child. @@

NICKI~


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1706
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/26/01 2:43:19 AM Mountain Standard Time, ... I totally agree. My mother was overinvolved in my own life and now feels it is her duty to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/26/01 2:43:19 AM Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Whats the concensus here on grandparent involvement?
>
> My personal beleif is they raised their children and don't have any
> rights to how you raise yours UNLESS ASKED SPECIFICALLY.
>
> Dialogue on this anyone?
>
>
>

I totally agree. My mother was overinvolved in my own life and now feels
it is her duty to interject wisdom. TG we live across the country.

NICKI~
